translation.en: [man 1] The importance of the story, to me--
it's so American.
Everybody came to America for a new life.
translation.ko: 많은 사람들이 새로운 삶을 찾기 위해 미국에 왔습니다

translation.en: John Demjanjuk came here for a new life.
translation.ko: 존 뎀얀유크 역시 새로운 삶을 위해 이곳에 왔죠

translation.en: And several years into it,
it was turned upside down.
[man 2] John Demjanjuk had a small house.
He had children. He was a family man.
He fixed the kids' bikes.
He worked at the Ford plant.
He was a normal Cleveland guy.
[man 3] He was living the American dream. He was a good American citizen.
translation.ko: 그는 아메리칸 드림을 꿈꿨습니다 정부가 그를 '공포의 이반'이라고 지목하기 전까지

translation.en: Up until the government came along and said he was Ivan the Terrible.
[man 4] Ivan the Terrible was one of the cruelest people
who ever existed on the planet Earth.
translation.ko: 가장 잔인한 사람 중 한 명이었죠

translation.en: [man 5] This was the man who stood outside of the gas chambers with a sword
translation.ko: 이 사람은 가스실 밖 칼을 들고 서서는

translation.en: and cut off the breasts of Jewish women.
Who pushed children into the gas chambers,
and did so with a relish.
[woman] Your-- Your mind just wants to-- to put a screen up
translation.ko: 우리는 이러한 현실을 마주하려고 하지 않죠

translation.en: in front of what really happened,
'cause you-- you really don't want to know that human beings did that to each other.
translation.ko: 저질렀다는 사실을 믿고 싶지 않기 때문이죠

translation.en: [man 6] The man I saw as John Demjanjuk could have been a monster.
translation.ko: 제가 본 존 뎀얀유크는 괴물이었을 수도

translation.en: Or he could have been a victim of wrong identity.
translation.ko: 아니면 잘못된 신원파악이 초래한 피해자였을 수도 있습니다

translation.en: [man 6] In my deepest center of fear is that I think he could be anybody.
translation.ko: 저의 가장 큰 두려움은 누구든지 그처럼 될 수 있었다는 겁니다

translation.en: You know, it's funny that I'm back over here in this area now
translation.ko: 제가 이곳에 다시 돌아왔다는 게 참 신기한 것 같아요

translation.en: because I've moved probably seven, eight times
translation.ko: 왜냐면 지금까지 한 일곱, 여덟 번 정도

translation.en: in my life so far,
and all very close to the Ukrainian Village.
I keep being brought back here.
We're comin' down the street now
where my grandparents have lived for the majority of their life.
translation.ko: 인생 대부분을 살았던 곳이 있는 거리가 나옵니다

translation.en: This was home to me in more than one way.
Seven Hills is a real quiet community.
It's very close-knit.
When you look at the news stories,
you never hear anything bad coming out of Seven Hills.
translation.ko: 세븐힐즈에 대한 어떠한 나쁜 얘기를 찾아 보기 힘들 정도죠

translation.en: The only reason anybody has ever heard of Seven Hills
would be because of my grandfather's case.
translation.ko: 그건 분명 저희 할아버지 사건 때문일 겁니다

translation.en: Charges were filed today against retired Seven Hills autoworker John Demjanjuk.
translation.ko: "1985년 8월" 전직 자동차 업체 근로자 존 뎀얀유크가 오늘 기소됐습니다

translation.en: The 66-year-old Ukrainian native
translation.ko: 66세 우크라이나 출신 뎀얀유크는 나치 수용소 경비대원으로

translation.en: is accused of being a Nazi death camp guard named Ivan the Terrible.
[reporter 1] The death camp guard who played a major role
in the torture and gas chamber murders
translation.ko: 세계 2차 대전 당시 100만 명의 유대인 고문과

translation.en: of nearly one million Jews during World War II.
[reporter 2] The charges state that Demjanjuk was a notorious executioner
translation.ko: 악명 높은 사형 집행자로 알려진 뎀얌유크는

translation.en: in the Nazis' systematic murder of more than six million Jews.
translation.ko: 600만명 이상의 유대인 학살을 도운 혐의를 받고 있습니다

translation.en: He's accused of operating the gas chambers
translation.ko: 그는 폴란드 트레블링카로 불리는 죽음의 수용소에서

translation.en: at a death camp called Treblinka in Poland.
[reporter 3] Demjanjuk denies all charges,
claiming he is not Ivan the Terrible, and it's all a case of mistaken identity.
translation.ko: 자신은 악명 높은 '공포의 이반'이 아니며 이 사건은 잘못된 신원파악에서 비롯된 것이라 주장하고 있습니다

translation.en: [Ed Jr.] It was a zoo.
There were news crews, vehicles parked halfway down the street.
translation.ko: 그의 집 인근 거리에는 취재 차량들로 붐볐어요

translation.en: Especially here in Cleveland,
to have somebody that they can portray as this monster,
translation.ko: 그들이 누군가를 표현할 수 있는 대상은 이 괴물

translation.en: and as this, you know, villain.
[reporter 1] The man many consider as Ivan the Terrible faces deportation...
[Ed Jr.] You turn the TV on, and five out of six news channels
were reporting about my grandfather.
[reporter 2] All camera lenses are trained on this house.
translation.ko: 모든 카메라 렌즈는 이 집을 향하고 있습니다

translation.en: There's a Do Not Disturb sign on the door.
[Ed Jr.] He used to have 30, 40 people with signs
translation.ko: 마흔 명에 달하는 사람들이 팻말을 들고

translation.en: standing right here, where we are right now.
translation.ko: 현재 우리가 있는 이곳에 서 있었죠

translation.en: [Ed Jr.] People protesting that he's here...
translation.ko: 할아버지를 추방 시킬 목적으로 시위을 벌였죠

translation.en: weren't too happy that he was.
Demjanjuk insists it is a case of mistaken identity.
translation.ko: 뎀얀유크는 잘못된 신원 파악이라고 주장하고 있습니다

translation.en: A Treblinka survivor today insisted...
translation.ko: 하지만 오늘 트레블링카 강제 수용소 생존자는

translation.en: there was no mistake.
[interpreter] There has not been a single moment, not today or yesterday,
-[speaking Hebrew] -not a year ago or 20 years ago,
when this man hasn't been in my mind.
translation.ko: 그를 생각하지 않았던 적은 단 한 순간도 없었습니다

translation.en: He's there constantly.
[interviewer] Those witnesses testified that you herded the Jews
translation.ko: 목격자의 증언에 따르면 당신이 유대인들을 가스실로 넣었다고 했는데

translation.en: into the gas chamber.
Why would they say that?
I really don't know why they give that evidence.
translation.ko: 전 정말 모르겠습니다 그들이 왜 그런 증언을 했는지

translation.en: But why they give that evidence now?
translation.ko: 그리고 왜 이제 와서 그런 증언을 하는 거죠?

translation.en: Why didn't give that evidence in '45,
when the war was ended?
[interviewer] Were you ever a guard
translation.ko: 나치 친위대 강제 수용소 경비대원으로 일했었나요?

translation.en: -in an SS Nazi extermination camp? -Never. Never. Never.
translation.ko: 나치 친위대 강제 수용소 경비대원으로 일했었나요? 절대 없습니다

translation.en: [newscaster] What we are looking at is a case
which may be unprecedented in international scope.
A naturalized American charged with war crimes in a 28-page indictment.
translation.ko: 미국 귀화인이 나치 전범 혐의로 기소됐습니다

translation.en: It is the biggest case since Adolf Eichmann was convicted
translation.ko: 1962년 아돌프 아이히만의 유죄 판결 이래 가장 큰 사건이며

translation.en: back in 1962, and it may well be the last war crimes case
translation.ko: 1962년 아돌프 아이히만의 유죄 판결 이래 가장 큰 사건이며 이는 마지막 홀로코스트 사건이 될 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: to come out of the Holocaust.
translation.ko: 이는 마지막 홀로코스트 사건이 될 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: [man] Ford was a place that, if you stayed a week,
you knew you were gonna stay the rest of your life.
It was family.
The people that came to work at Ford
from Germany, the Ukraine,
-they did their job, hardly ever talked... -[flames roar]
...then they disappeared into the darkness.
The work was incredibly hard.
It was hot, it was noisy beyond comprehension.
translation.ko: 엄청난 더위에 말도 못할 정도로 시끄러웠죠

translation.en: But if you made it past one or two weeks...
that was it. They never left.
The one thing I remember, when the noise about what John might have been,
you know, came about,
that's all anybody talked about.
The shit hit the fan.
Everybody was talking about it,
and you never heard someone say something bad...
translation.ko: 하지만 단 한 명도 존에 대해 안 좋은 얘기를

translation.en: about John.
Everybody that worked at Ford was that way.
[man] I think a lot of people in Cleveland saw themselves in John Demjanjuk.
translation.ko: 클리블랜드에 사는 많은 사람들은 존 뎀얀유크의 입장에 공감했던 것 같아요

translation.en: Someone who came to this country and got married
translation.ko: 미국에 이민와 가정을 꾸리고 열심히 일한 사람들이라면 말이죠

translation.en: and worked hard.
And here was the government coming in and grabbing him by the scruff of the neck
translation.ko: 미국 정부가 갑자기 개입해 뎀얀유크의 목덜미를 잡고

translation.en: and hauling him into court, take-- trying to take away his citizenship,
translation.ko: 법정으로 소환시켜 그의 시민권을 빼앗으려 하자

translation.en: and that-- that scared them. That scared them.
[Holodnak] But...
a sociopath can live among you...
your whole life, and you don't know it till he eats you.
translation.ko: 단, 그들에게 피해를 입기 전에는 존재를 모르죠

translation.en: [man] I've spent my career working at the Office of Special Investigations.
The so-called "Nazi Hunting Unit."
The Demjanjuk case is traceable
to a list of war criminals in the United States.
translation.ko: 미국 전범자 명단에서도 찾아볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: Survivor witnesses pointed to Demjanjuk's photo
and said, "We remember him."
He was the guard they knew at Treblinka.
The gas chamber operator, Ivan the Terrible.
No decent government could just stand by
and say, "Well, that was then, and this is now." No.
He had to be removed from the United States.
Ivan the Terrible was...
one of the cruelest people who ever existed on the planet Earth.
translation.ko: 지구상에 존재했던 가장 잔인한 사람 중 하나였죠

translation.en: One point seven million Jews were annihilated in Poland,
and Ivan the Terrible...
did the dirty work.
Someone who delighted in herding men,
women, children, and babies into a gas chamber.
Who delighted in using a blade, I think a sword even,
to, um, torture people,
um, in their final moments.
The horror of it.
The despair of it.
The cruelty of it is... is so... overwhelming.
One has to... has to struggle not to think about it all the time.
translation.ko: 애써 떠올리지 않으려고 노력해야 하는 수준이죠

translation.en: [man] The United States had no jurisdiction
over John Demjanjuk.
He didn't commit the crime in an American territory,
translation.ko: 그는 미국 영토 내에서 범죄를 자행하지 않았고

translation.en: and he didn't commit the crime against Americans.
There's only one way
that you can get a former Nazi hiding in America.
-[crowd clamoring] -[Rashke] He can be deported.
[reporter] Demjanjuk, already stripped of his citizenship
and facing deportation proceedings, is under a new threat.
translation.ko: 추방 절차를 밟는 도중 또 다른 위기에 직면하게 되었습니다

translation.en: For in the most ominous development of all, the Israeli government is seeking
his extradition as a war criminal.
translation.ko: 전범자로 인도하여 처벌할 권리를 주장하고 있습니다

translation.en: [in Hebrew] At the district court in Jerusalem,
an indictment was served today against John Demjanjuk,
suspected of being Ivan the Terrible, the murderer of Treblinka.
translation.ko: 일명 '공포의 이반'으로 알려진 존 뎀얀유크를 기소했습니다

translation.en: [in English] He feels bad that we have to be out here.
translation.ko: 아버지는 우리가 재판을 지켜보는 것을 원치 않았습니다

translation.en: That, you know...
Everything that's going on, to the family,
translation.ko: 가족들이 겪어야 하는 이 모든 일을

translation.en: it... it hurts him.
But we're gonna fully support him
because we care and we believe in what he's doing,
translation.ko: 우리 아버지를 아끼고 그를 믿기 때문입니다

translation.en: and we'll back him up all the way.
[man] I have nothing but bottomless sympathy and feelings for the Demjanjuk family.
They-- They felt it to their core that their father was innocent,
and they did everything in their power, I believe.
translation.ko: 할 수 있는 모든 것을 했죠

translation.en: I think they made a lot of mistakes, but who wouldn't?
translation.ko: 물론 많은 실수를 하기도 했지만 실수 없는 사람이 어디 있나요?

translation.en: It's such a new role for anybody to take on.
[man] We know exactly the kind of person Ivan the Terrible is,
translation.ko: '공포의 이반'이 어떤 사람인지 저희는 정확히 압니다

translation.en: and that person is definitely not my father.
He's an innocent man.
They arrested an innocent man. Now they put an innocent man in jail.
translation.ko: 그들은 결백한 사람을 체포했고 감옥에 넣으려 합니다

translation.en: We've got all kinds of information. They don't want to hear it.
translation.ko: 우리는 온갖 정보를 가지고 있지만 그들은 들으려 하지 않아요

translation.en: They don't even want it to go to court. They want to get him out of here,
translation.ko: 법정에 제출하지 못하게 하고 아버지를 추방하려고만 합니다

translation.en: and they want to keep the medias confused about it and get him out of here.
translation.ko: 그들은 여론을 조작해 아버지를 추방하려 합니다

translation.en: [man] Lydia Demjanjuk gave me a call.
At that point in time, I didn't have any idea...
translation.ko: 그때 당시 저는 이 사건에 대해... "마크 오코너 뎀얀유크의 변호사"

translation.en: uh, what the story was,
or whether I wanted to get involved with anything.
translation.ko: 이 사건을 맡아야 할지에 대한 확신이 없었습니다

translation.en: I had a conversation with my dad. He said, "Go there, see what you think."
translation.ko: 아버지께서는 직접 가서 만나보라고 조언해 주었죠

translation.en: So finally, I got there,
and greeted John, who's on the front lawn, and he's doin' stuff.
And all his flowers everywhere. Beautiful, green flowers everywhere.
I said, "Ivan the Terrible doin' all this flower stuff?"
translation.ko: '공포의 이반'이 꽃을 가꾸고 있는 모습이 낯설었죠

translation.en: [O'Connor] He was the perfect immigrant. Ukrainian immigrant,
in the Ukrainian community, going to the Ukrainian church.
He was a great worker at the Ford plant.
translation.ko: 그는 포드 공장에서도 좋은 평가를 받았습니다

translation.en: Never had a fight, never been arrested, never got a speeding ticket.
translation.ko: 싸움에 휘말리거나 체포된 적도 심지어 속도위반도 하지 않았죠

translation.en: And I'm thinking, "Okay, maybe he's hiding something.
translation.ko: 그는 무언가를 숨기고 있다는 생각이 들었죠

translation.en: Maybe he's the best actor on the planet."
translation.ko: 그는 최고의 연기자일 거라는 생각이 들었습니다

translation.en: I saw all the allegations. I'm thinking...
translation.ko: 뎀얀유크에 관한 혐의를 검토하던 중 생각했죠

translation.en: "How is this possible for a human being to do that?"
translation.ko: '이게 과연 인간이 할 수 있는 짓인가?'

translation.en: You've got that image, and it's very strong.
It goes into your heart, it goes down into your guts. It goes everywhere.
I don't care what you say.
I don't care what the proof is, he's Ivan the Terrible.
[reporter] The crucial evidence in this case was this SS Identity pass
translation.ko: 이번 사건의 결정적인 증거는 그의 이름과 인적사항이 적힌

translation.en: bearing Demjanjuk's name and accurate personal details.
[interviewer] Mr. Demjanjuk, was that your picture?
I don't know.
-[interviewer] You can't be sure? -I'm not sure. I don't know.
I never see that picture.
translation.ko: 한 번도 본 적이 없는 사진입니다

translation.en: [O'Connor] So, I go with Lydia in the basement.
She said, "Look, I know the story. I know what's going on."
translation.ko: '이 사건에 대해 잘 알고 있다' 라고 그녀는 말했죠

translation.en: And she's got piles of documents.
translation.ko: 그녀는 어마어마한 양의 서류를 가지고 있었어요

translation.en: The Justice Department presented evidence
translation.ko: 법무부는 소련의 국가 보안 위원회에서 받은

translation.en: right from the KGB.
"Look, here's Michael Hanusiak.
Here's news from the Ukraine. Here's who he is.
Here's how they set up the Ukraine.
Here's how they drive a wedge between Ukrainians and Jews."
This is typical disinformatia.
And then, at that point, I said, "I'm gonna see this through."
translation.ko: 그 순간 저는 이 일을 끝까지 파고들겠다고 결심했죠

translation.en: [reporter] John Demjanjuk has tried to disprove accusations
translation.ko: 존 뎀얀유크는 나치 강제 수용소 경비대원으로

translation.en: that he was a Nazi concentration camp guard in Poland.
translation.ko: 일한 혐의를 전면 부인하고 있는 가운데

translation.en: His fight is being waged with a new intensity today
translation.ko: 뎀얀유크 변호인 마크 오코너 선임과 함께

translation.en: by a new attorney, Mark O'Connor.
This man has never had the right to jury trial,
never had the right to confrontation of his accusers.
translation.ko: 그의 고소인과 법정 분쟁을 벌일 권리 또한 박탈 당했습니다

translation.en: They identified a picture,
and that's the picture on the phony KGB card
translation.ko: 소련 국가 보안 위원회가 위조한 것입니다

translation.en: that we have already exposed to the people and to the court as being a total fraud.
translation.ko: 이는 이미 언론사와 법원에 공개한 사안입니다

translation.en: [reporter] White House communications director Patrick Buchanan
believes the Soviets are trying to frame the Ukrainian expatriate.
translation.ko: 소련이 전 우크라이나 애국자를 모함하는 거라고 믿고 있습니다

translation.en: I think the ID card is-- is inauthentic.
I think it's a forgery.
[man] The only evidence they had against him
translation.ko: 소련이 제시한 신분증만이 뎀얀유크의 유죄를 입증할 수 있는

translation.en: was from the Soviet Union,
and the Soviet evidence and the Soviet Union cannot be trusted.
translation.ko: 그리고 소련은 물론 그들이 제시한 증거물도 믿어서는 안 됩니다

translation.en: [reporter] The Cold War has created a mood of crisis and suspicion between the East and West.
translation.ko: 냉전은 위기감과 동서양 간의 불신을 조성했습니다

translation.en: All the moral values which this country cherishes
translation.ko: 상반된 이념을 가진 소련과 미국의 적대 관계가 형성되면서

translation.en: are fundamentally challenged by a powerful adversary,
which does not wish these values to survive.
They are the focus of evil in the modern world.
[man] I suppose one interesting question to ask
is why is the Soviet Union even passing this information on?
translation.ko: 왜 소련이 그 정보를 미국에 넘겼는지입니다

translation.en: The Soviets took a decent amount of relish
in revealing the fact that many collaborators
translation.ko: 서구 민주주의를 보호막으로 삼고 있다는 사실을

translation.en: had found sanctuary in "Western" democracy.
translation.ko: 서구 민주주의를 보호막으로 삼고 있다는 사실을  밝히며 재미를 봤죠

translation.en: The black hand of the KGB,
which has caused the deaths of millions of innocent, unarmed men,
translation.ko: 수백만 명의 무고한 민간인과 아이들이 희생됐습니다

translation.en: women, and children
is now the guiding light in pinpointing Ukrainian Americans,
translation.ko: 그들은 이제 미국에 거주하는 러시아인들을 제외한

translation.en: and other ethnic non-Russian nationalities in America, who are being denounced as Nazi collaborators and worse.
translation.ko: 모든 이민자를 나치 협력자로 매도하고 있습니다

translation.en: [Douglas] The other thing is that
there were two pretty anti-Soviet groups in the United States:
Ukrainian Americans and Jewish Americans.
Instead of having an alliance against the Soviets,
translation.ko: 소련에 적대적인 두 단체의 동맹을 막기 위해

translation.en: the Soviets were trying to drive a wedge between these two anti-Soviet groups.
[all chanting] Deport the Nazi now! Deport the Nazi now!
I want him out of here before I die.
-[crowd clamoring] -[man] We Ukrainians born in the United States
will not allow the persecution of our parents -in this free country! -[crowd cheers]
translation.ko: 우리 부모가 자유 국가에서 박해받는 걸 용납할 수 없다!

translation.en: [Henry] The Ukrainian community felt just as important
translation.ko: 클리블랜드에 사는 유대인 공동체뿐만 아니라 우크라이나계 미국인 역시 사태의 심각성을 알았죠

translation.en: as the Jewish community in Cleveland.
translation.ko: 우크라이나계 미국인 역시 사태의 심각성을 알았죠

translation.en: And once each side saw what was at stake here,
the line was drawn.
[group] Demjanjuk is innocent!
[all chanting] Your neighbor is a Nazi. Your neighbor is a Nazi.
[man] Leave John alone!
[all chanting] Let him go home!
What do you know about it?
-[man 1] Six million! -[men] Never again! -Six million! -[men] Never again!
[man 2] I pity the man. I mean, to live and think that, you know,
translation.ko: 그가 참 불쌍했죠 당장에라도 죽을 수 있다는

translation.en: at any minute, you could die.
At any minute, somebody could walk up to you and blow your head off
translation.ko: 언제든지 누군가 다가와 당신의 머리를 날려버릴 수 있죠

translation.en: 'cause they're a fanatic.
I wish all the people would stay off this street,
translation.ko: 이 사람들이 거리에서 사라져 줬으면 좋겠습니다

translation.en: leave the residents in Seven Hills alone.
If you don't live here, you're not involved in the city, please.
translation.ko: 여기에 사는 사람이 아니면 제발 개입하지 말아 주세요

translation.en: We got to all live on this planet together,
and if-- and if we don't soon start burying the ax,
things are gonna get out of hand.
translation.ko: 사태는 걷잡을 수 없이 커질 겁니다

translation.en: [reporter 1] Decision time. Does Demjanjuk stay, or does he go?
[reporter 2] If Demjanjuk loses that battle,
the United States secretary of state will make the decision
on whether or not to extradite him to Israel.
translation.ko: 그를 이스라엘로 인도할지 말지 결정하게 됩니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] Members of the Ukrainian community
started gathering outside the federal courthouse
translation.ko: 우크라이나계 미국인들이  오전 8시 30분부터 연방법원 청사 밖에서

translation.en: at 8:30 this morning,
waiting for the decision to be handed down.
[reporter 3] And then it came,
Judge Battisti declaring John Demjanjuk guilty.
[reporter 4] John Demjanjuk could be extradited to Israel today,
translation.ko: 존 뎀얀유크는 당장 오늘이라도 이스라엘로 추방되어

translation.en: where he will be facing a death sentence for alleged crimes against humanity.
translation.ko: 반인류적인 범죄 혐의로 사형에 처할 수 있습니다

translation.en: This is not just a fraud as far as Mr. Demjanjuk is concerned.
translation.ko: 뎀얀유크가 관련되어 있는 한 이건 그냥 사기가 아닙니다

translation.en: It's a fraud on the people.
[reporter 5] Any reaction at all?
-Did you-- -The blood is now on your hands.
Did-- Did you say anything at all to your father?
[reporter, in Hebrew] Nazi criminal John Demjanjuk
was transferred tonight to an undisclosed location
translation.ko: 맨해튼의 연방 감옥에서 공개되지 않은 장소로

translation.en: from the federal prison in Manhattan.
From there, he'll be transferred to Kennedy Airport on his way to Israel.
translation.ko: 그는 다시 케네디 공항으로 이송돼 이스라엘로 인도됩니다

translation.en: [man, in English] Several months after I started to work at the Ministry of Justice in Israel,
translation.ko: 제가 이스라엘 법무부에서 근무한 지 몇 개월 후

translation.en: Dennis Goldman gives me a box,
and he says, "This box contains the transcripts
of depositions and trial
of a man by the name of John Demjanjuk."
When I opened the box, it was unequivocal
that John Demjanjuk was Ivan the Terrible,
translation.ko: 저는 존 뎀얀유크가 틀림없이 '공포의 이반'이라는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: the person who stood
outside the gas chamber
in what was called the Himmel Strasse,
the road to heaven.
It was very important not to let this man get away.
translation.ko: 그가 반드시 죗값을 치르게 하는 게 매우 중요했죠

translation.en: I remember the scene of his arrival in Israel.
There were bleachers that were set
where the media would stand.
We had drilled it with INS,
translation.ko: 미국 이민 귀화국과 미리 예행 연습을 했죠

translation.en: uh, to the extent that the US Marshals would bring him down.
And at that point,
there would be an exchange of the prisoner
to Israeli police officers.
[Gabay] Demjanjuk steps down,
the US Marshals are at his side,
and Demjanjuk turns to him,
somehow explains to him
that he wants to kiss the ground of the holy land.
The US Marshal says no,
but then he turns to Alex Ish-Shalom and says he wants to kiss the ground,
translation.ko: 그는 알렉시 샬롬에게 땅에 입을 맞추게 해달라 했고

translation.en: and Alex Ish-Shalom says no.
He wanted to show that here was the very religious man
translation.ko: 뎀얀유크는 자신이 절대 살인을 하지 못할 정도로

translation.en: who could never have killed anyone.
Almost within two hours of his landing in Israel,
translation.ko: 그는 이스라엘에 도착한 지 두 시간 만에

translation.en: he is interrogated.
[Gabay] He sat down.
And when he sat down, he looked at the detective,
and he said, with a beaming smile,
-Shalom! -[Gabay] "Shalom."
And he was looking at the investigators like he was going to toy with them.
[reporter 1] How do you feel?
I feel good now, thank you.
[Ed Jr.] Nobody ever accepted that he's not coming back.
translation.ko: 그가 돌아오지 못할 거라곤 아무도 생각하지 않았어요

translation.en: Everybody always tried to remain optimistic
that, in the end, the truth will prevail.
You know, God will-- God is good, and God'll take care.
translation.ko: 하느님이... 좋은 분이고 보듬어 주실 거라고요

translation.en: Make sure that he comes home to us safe.
translation.ko: 그가 우리 곁으로 돌아올 수 있게 해주실 겁니다

translation.en: [reporter, in Hebrew] American counsel Mark O'Connor arrived in Israel today
translation.ko: 미국에서 뎀얀유크의 변호를 맡은 변호인 마크 오코너가

translation.en: after defending John Demjanjuk in the US prior to his extradition here.
[O'Connor, in English] I'm pulling up to Ayalon,
and I'm looking at the prison.
And I'm saying, "What is this?"
You got all these psychedelic paintings.
I mean, not just, like, in one spot.
translation.ko: 한 곳에만 그림이 그려져 있지 않았고

translation.en: The whole prison is a Picasso painting.
translation.ko: 감옥 전체가 피카소 그림 그 자체였죠

translation.en: I got through all these different gates,
and the first thing you see when you walk in
is the area where the two guards sleep.
So, you have the two guards watching him 24 hours a day in a solitary cell.
translation.ko: 두 명의 경비원들이 독방에 있는 그를 24시간 감시했죠

translation.en: [O'Connor] I'm the first person from... Cleveland,
you know, over there to see him.
Demjanjuk, in that cell,
kept saying to me, "What are you gettin' so excited about?"
I said, "What am I getting so--
You're the guy that's gonna hang. What are you talkin' about?
Said, "I'm not gonna hang. I am not gonna hang."
And he's reading his Bible, and "My guardian angel's here."
translation.ko: 성경책을 읽고 있던 그는 수호천사가 왔다고 말했죠

translation.en: I'm a Catholic,
so I'm not gonna put down guardian angels, okay?
So I'm sayin', "I don't know what's going on here."
[reporter] He has 90 days to get ready.
The trial should start just before New Year's Day.
translation.ko: 해가 넘어 가기 전에 재판이 열릴 것으로 보입니다

translation.en: [O'Connor] There's still a-- a blending going on,
uh, between Demjanjuk and Ivan the Terrible,
and I think these experienced trial judges...
[in Hebrew] Mr. O'Connor, he looked for an Israeli attorney...
translation.ko: 오코너 변호사는 이스라엘 법을 숙지하고 있는 "노아 클라이거 이스라엘 기자"

translation.en: who would help them understand Israeli law,
but he couldn't find any.
translation.ko: 하지만 그를 도와줄 변호사를 찾지 못했죠

translation.en: Fifteen Israeli attorneys so far have refused
to assist in the defense of John Demjanjuk.
[in English] Pressure.
Who wants to put their whole career on the line?
translation.ko: 누가 자신의 커리어를 걸고 모험을 하겠어요?

translation.en: What if he is Ivan the Terrible?
I couldn't spend $600,000, I couldn't spend $400,000,
translation.ko: 저는 그를 혼자서 변호하고 있기 때문에

translation.en: because I am doing this on my own. That's why I didn't come forward.
[Klieger, in Hebrew] They spent months looking for a lawyer, and no one would do it.
No one wanted to be involved.
Then, they found Sheftel.
[man, in English] There is a Yiddish expression,
uh, called... [speaks Yiddish]
It's a person that refuse to obey the general norms,
and to behave exactly as expected.
-A troublemaker. -[interviewer] And you enjoy being this?
Uh, yes, yes. I don't have to put too much effort towards it.
translation.ko: 물론이죠. 별다른 노력을 들일 필요가 없으니까요

translation.en: It's come out of me naturally.
After ten years, uh, acting as a defense lawyer,
I came to a definite description
of, uh, the Israeli prosecution
as a factory of travesty of justice.
-[reporter] Are you innocent? -I'm an innocent man. I'm wrong man.
[Sheftel] I heard about Ivan the Terrible
before he was extradited from the US to Israel.
I was, uh, like any other Israeli,
positively convinced that Ivan the Terrible is John Demjanjuk.
I had no doubt whatsoever.
I started, I don't know why. Don't have any... any explanation why,
but I started to think about it almost every day.
translation.ko: 이 사건에 대해 매일 생각하기 시작했어요

translation.en: Looking for every piece of information
in any newspaper or radio or television whatsoever.
It occurred to me that the essence of the evidence against him...
may be very flawed.
The entire adventure...
may be a shocking farce.
I said to O'Connor, "I'm in the case.
translation.ko: 저는 오코너 변호사한테 이 사건을 맡겠다고 했어요

translation.en: The man is not Ivan the Terrible."
[Gabay] The first time that I saw Sheftel,
he embodied, for me, a traitor.
[Henry] I thought of Sheftel as being a showman at first.
A showboat, I should say.
He was quite...
uh, larger than life.
[Klieger, in Hebrew] I can't tell you what I think about Sheftel,
translation.ko: 세프텔에 대한 언급을 하면 당장이라도 고소 당할까봐

translation.en: because he'd sue me immediately.
translation.ko: 그에 대해 어떻게 생각하는지 말할 수가 없네요

translation.en: But I'm sorry that there are Jews like Sheftel.
translation.ko: 하지만 세프텔 같은 유대인이 있다는 게 유감스럽습니다

translation.en: I'm ashamed of it.
Yoram, let's say you're defending a murderer,
and for some reason or another,
you can build him a stellar defense.
Would you get him acquitted?
translation.ko: 피고인이 무죄 판결을 받게 할 건가요?

translation.en: With enthusiasm.
[in English] A person is entitled to a defense. I understand.
I saw Sheftel's involvement
such that he had a little bit too much of a relish
to get Mr. Demjanjuk found not guilty.
translation.ko: 과하다 싶을 정도로 즐기는 것 같았죠

translation.en: I have no respect for him.
None.
[younger Henry] Reporters and photographers are arriving here daily.
Most are here for the duration of what they call the trial of the decade.
translation.ko: 대부분은 '세기의 재판'을 취재하기 위해 이곳에 왔습니다

translation.en: [Henry] When this story came up
and I was assigned to get on an airplane to fly over to Jerusalem,
translation.ko: 저는 사건을 보도하기 위해 예루살렘에 왔죠

translation.en: I didn't know the true scope of the story
until I got there and saw the interest.
Everybody had a complete understanding of what the evidence was against this man,
translation.ko: 그의 표정, 말투만 봐도  모든 사람은 이번 재판에서

translation.en: from the way he looked, from the way he spoke.
You could tell their minds were pretty much made up.
If you ask me, I think he's guilty.
I think he is guilty.
If this guy is guilty, well, then, he's gotta pay the price.
[Henry] Most people had a stronger opinion than I did.
That I can be sure of
'cause they all said, "There's no doubt that he's guilty.
It'll be over in a nanosecond."
I don't think I have the capacity,
'cause somewhere in my mind is always the little nagging voice saying,
"Are you sure you've got enough information?
Are you sure you're not gonna be making a mistake?"
translation.ko: '실수를 하면 어쩌지?'라는 생각들이 자리 잡고 있었죠

translation.en: And that's exactly how I felt in that courtroom in-- in Jerusalem.
[reporter] The city of Jerusalem has been gearing up for the Demjanjuk trial for the past year,
translation.ko: 예루살렘은 지난 1년 동안 뎀얀유크 재판을 위해 준비했으며

translation.en: and finally, the trial is set to start here
at the city's sprawling convention complex.
When it starts, the trial will be conducted here under very tight security.
translation.ko: 재판은 철저한 보안 속에서 진행될 예정입니다

translation.en: Soldiers and police will be on duty everywhere,
providing extraordinary protection
during the entire length of the court case.
The newspapers here are reporting the Demjanjuk case extensively.
translation.ko: 현지 신문은 뎀얀유크 사건을 대대적으로 보도하고 있습니다

translation.en: Television has weighed the merits of the trial for months.
translation.ko: 텔레비전은 이번 사건을 몇 개월 동안 다뤘고

translation.en: And soon, the actual court case begins.
We're still confident that justice will be done,
and my father will be exonerated. And there won't be another...
translation.ko: 아버지는 곧 혐의를 벗을 것이고 다시는 이런 희생은...

translation.en: crucifixion.
[reporter, in Hebrew] Where did you come from at this early hour?
translation.ko: 이렇게 이른 시간에 어디서 오시는 길입니까?

translation.en: Ramat Gan.
-[reporter] Why? -Why?
I told you. I lost them all.
translation.ko: 이미 말씀드렸잖아요 전 모든 걸 잃었습니다

translation.en: [in English] The three-judge panel begins hearing the Demjanjuk case
translation.ko: 두 시간 후면 뎀얀유크의 첫 공판이

translation.en: in this courtroom within the next two hours.
translation.ko: 두 시간 후면 뎀얀유크의 첫 공판이 이 곳 법정에서 시작됩니다

translation.en: [reporter 1, in Hebrew] Each visitor's personal details were logged,
translation.ko: 재판을 보러 온 사람들은 인적사항을 기재했고

translation.en: and metal objects caused the metal detector to buzz.
translation.ko: 법정에 들어가기 위해선 금속 탐지기를 통과해야 합니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] What would you like the outcome to be?
I want him to hang.
I'd hang him myself.
translation.ko: 제가 직접 그의 목을 매달 것입니다

translation.en: Or burn him.
[reporter 1] A few minutes after 7:00,
two hours before the trial is set to begin,
John Demjanjuk is brought in from Ayalon Prison.
[reporter 3, in English] The man Israelis say is the Butcher of Treblinka
went on trial in Jerusalem today.
[in Hebrew] The John Demjanjuk trial began today
at the International Convention Center in Jerusalem.
[reporter 4, in English] This is so much more than a trial of one man's guilt.
translation.ko: 이번 재판은 단순히 한 남성의 유죄를 판결하는 게 아닙니다

translation.en: This is a hearing of history.
When Eichmann was on trial,
my mother made me watch it.
translation.ko: 저희 어머니께서 재판을 꼭 보게 했습니다

translation.en: Now Demjanjuk is on trial, and I want my child to watch it.
translation.ko: 이번엔 우리 아이들이 뎀얀유크가 재판을 받는 걸 보게 할 겁니다

translation.en: This is the only safeguard we have that it never happens again.
translation.ko: 다시는 이런 일이 일어나지 않게 하기 위해서죠

translation.en: All the research I'd done, all, everything--
translation.ko: 지금까지 몇 년간 제가 조사한 모든 것...

translation.en: This was the culmination of years and years.
Here I am,
one or two hours of sleep, going on adrenaline,
translation.ko: 한 두시간 밖에 못 잔 채

translation.en: having to be ready.
[Sheftel] This is a case of...
establishment atrocity
from bottom to top.
A cover-up and a frame-up...
in a show trial.
[Sheftel] I was hundred percent convinced
that Demjanjuk is not Ivan the Terrible.
Yet, I'm convinced hundred percent
that he would be found guilty and sentenced to death.
But I was sure...
that I would manage
to destroy the show.
[in Hebrew] All rise!
Case 3736, State of Israel vs. John Ivan Demjanjuk.
translation.ko: 사건 3736번 이스라엘 대 존 이반 뎀얀유크 "도브 레빈 판사"

translation.en: The accused will rise.
-Please state your name. -Uh...
[Levin] What's your name?
[in Ukrainian] Honorable court, my name is John Demjanjuk.
[Levin, in Hebrew] I must warn you,
that you must tell the truth and the whole truth.
If you don't, you will be punished by law.
translation.ko: 만일 거짓말을 말하면 위증의 벌을 받게 됩니다

translation.en: [in English] John, you're being accused of being at Treblinka
and participating in the horrendous crimes at that death killing camp.
translation.ko: 잔혹한 범죄에 가담한 혐의를 받고 있습니다

translation.en: Uh, would you tell the court, at this instance,
what your answer is with regard to you ever being at that location
and perpetrating any of these crimes?
translation.ko: 잔혹한 범죄에 가담한 사실이 맞는지 말씀해 주세요

translation.en: [in Ukrainian] The honorable bench,
I'm accused here of having been at Treblinka.
translation.ko: 제가 트레블링카에 있었다는 혐의를 받고 있는데

translation.en: This is not true.
I was never either at Treblinka or Sobibor
or at any other such place.
translation.ko: 또는 다른 수용소에 간 적이 없습니다

translation.en: Because I am not Ivan the Terrible.
And the most just witness to this is God himself.
I am innocent, innocent, innocent.
[man, in English] I studied Demjanuk's character,
translation.ko: 저는 뎀얀유크의 성격 그리고 그의 반응을

translation.en: Demjanjuk's reaction.
I realized he will never confess.
translation.ko: 그리고 그가 절대 자백하지 않을 걸 알았죠

translation.en: He would rather stay and maybe die
as the father and the grandfather
uh, that he was later on in Cleveland.
In every normal criminal case, you have a scene of crime.
translation.ko: 모든 범죄 사건에는 범죄 현장이 있습니다

translation.en: But the Nazis, they have burnt and destroyed most of the evidence.
translation.ko: 하지만 나치는 대부분의 증거들을 태워 없애 버렸죠

translation.en: The same goes to eyewitnesses.
I mean, most of them were exterminated by the Germans.
And yet, I have to lead this trial.
translation.ko: 그런데도 불구하고 전 이 재판에 뛰어들었죠

translation.en: [in Hebrew] The prosecution would like to invite Pinchas Epstein.
translation.ko: 검사 측은 피나체 엡스타인을 증인으로 법정에 세웁니다

translation.en: [in English] This trial was filled with so much passion,
so much pain, and so much history.
Survivors were dying every day.
And this was a last glimpse and effort
to hear them, to put it in language, and to listen.
[younger Shaked, in Hebrew] I would ask of you to start with your date of birth.
I am Epstein Pinchas, son of Dov and Sara.
translation.ko: 저는 도브와 사라의 아들 엡스타인 피나체입니다

translation.en: I was born in Czestochowa on March 3, 1925.
I understand that, from the moment you arrived at the death camp,
you were assigned to carry bodies from the gas chambers to the pits.
translation.ko: 가스실 시체들을 구덩이로 옮기는 임무를 받았나요?

translation.en: [Pinchas] Correct.
I sat at a spot where I could see
the engine of the gas chambers.
It was the machine house.
And I saw a man come out of the gas chamber.
translation.ko: 한 남자가 가스실에서 나오는 것을 봤고

translation.en: Later, I learned his name was Ivan. Ivan the Terrible.
I saw a large man, and he was operating the engine.
They ordered to open the doors and take out the corpses.
translation.ko: 그들은 가스실 문을 열고 시체들을 꺼내라고 지시했죠

translation.en: This Ivan would come out of the engine room
and beat us with his pipe.
Sometimes he would carry a sword.
And he would crush skulls, cut ears, and torture the prisoners.
translation.ko: 그는 사람 머리를 으스러뜨리고 귀를 자르고 고문했습니다

translation.en: It was unbelievable.
Your Honors, we took out corpses. It was horrific to see.
translation.ko: 전 가스실에서 시체를 꺼냈습니다 매우 끔찍했죠

translation.en: People with crushed faces, people with knife wounds,
translation.ko: 형체를 알아볼 수 없을 정도로 망가진 얼굴과 수많은 칼자국들

translation.en: pregnant women stabbed in the gut, people with eyes poked out.
translation.ko: 임신한 여성의 배를 칼로 찔렀고 사람들의 눈알을 뽑기도 했죠

translation.en: There are no words.
One day a living girl
came out of the gas chambers.
About 12 years old.
Her words still ring in my ears: "Yachtse du mamoshy."
translation.ko: 아직도 그녀가 한 말이 귀에 생생히 들립니다

translation.en: -[Levin] What do these words mean? -[voice breaking] "I want my mommy."
[crying] I have a granddaughter her age.
translation.ko: 저에게 그 여자아이 또래의 손녀딸이 있습니다

translation.en: Then they took her to the pit and shot her.
translation.ko: 그들은 여자아이를 구덩이로 데려가 총으로 쏴 죽였죠

translation.en: Your Honors, I see Ivan every night. I want to...
translation.ko: 존경하는 재판장님 전 매일 밤 이반을 꿈에서 봅니다

translation.en: My poor wife. I dream of him every night. I see him every night.
translation.ko: 제 불쌍한 아내와 저는 매일 꿈에서 그를 봅니다

translation.en: He is engraved in my memory. I cannot escape him.
translation.ko: 그는 제 기억에 새겨져 있습니다 그를 벗어날 수가 없습니다

translation.en: I see Ivan here, in front of me, as I remember him, as he lives in my mind.
translation.ko: 제가 또렷이 기억하는 이반이 제 눈앞에 있습니다

translation.en: There he is, as he stands here! Here he stands!
[Levin] Mr. Epstein!
Age has taken its toll, it's obvious, but not as much as to not know the man.
translation.ko: 많은 세월이 지났지만 저는 똑똑히 그를 기억합니다

translation.en: I see him, I see him, I see him.
-[man] Murderer! -[Irene] Shh!
[Tal] Be seated!
[Sheftel, in English] There is full entitlement
to seek brutal...
merciless revenge
from Ivan the Terrible.
I see a lot of value in revenge against the proper person,
translation.ko: 제대로 된 사람한테 복수를 하는 건 당연하죠

translation.en: not against a retired autoworker
which was mistakenly thought to be Ivan the Terrible...
as a victim of a conspiracy.
